page.title: 07Ulverston Retailing
page.content: Many shops are{local businesses,}eg. Birkett's (bakers),Benn's (green- grocer),Smith and Harrison (hardware). There are{2 supermarkets,}Walter Willson and the Co-op. Ulverston attracts shoppers from a large rural hinterland as far N. as Coniston and E. as Lindale but this position is encroached upon by superstores Asda in Barrow and Fine Fare,Kendal. The{Co-op}has 3 sites: supermarket, household goods and clothing. Several national{chain stores}are here: Boots, Woolworth,Foster and Rumbelows.Traders are worried about the effect of the planned redevelopment of Barrow shopp- ing centre. With the increase in tourism,pubs and restaurants are thriving. A recent addition,the Mandalay Steakhouse,in Fountain Street has Malaysian cuisine.
